data.title: avoid a surprise by keep notice of a change
data.body:
make a graphic indication for the "options" button in the lobby , when the default-rules of the map has been changed 

![option blink](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/3641531/f86afab0-10b4-11e4-8c94-75419e6d46e7.png)

this should remind players to check the options "before" hitting the ready-checkbox ... and prevent a "under-5-second-ragequit-because-someone-wasnt-aware-of-the-rules , and or doesnt agree with it"

data.title: Minor balance tweaks for TD
data.body: Playtesting has shown that the Stealth Tank is a little bit too good against infantry, which are supposed to be its (soft) natural counter. They are the only units which can detect the stealth tanks, so it's important that they not die too easily. Right now it seems that stealth tanks are able to sit and fight infantry very easily, especially since they outrange them. This change will discourage stealth tanks from engaging infantry without care.

data.title: Nerf flame tank
data.body: It is a bit too fast, especially given that its armor was upgraded. Still faster than medium tank.

data.title: searching for resource center doesnt disappear
data.body:
Plattform:
Windows x64 (tested on Windows 7 and 8.1)
Dont know if others are affected, too

Problem:
You cant install map cause it constantly says "searching for resource center"

How to reproduce
- Install current release
- Start, install your stuff and so on
- Install playtest in seperate directory
- Start
  After this procedure, the release Installation cant install maps out of the game cause it constantly says "searching for resource center"

Workaround
Install maps manually
or
Just install the release you actual playing before start new

data.title: Improved D2K AI
data.body: Added AI builds Saboteur and Stealth Raider, Fixed Raider not build by Omnius and changed tower percents.

data.title: Power down and not enough power should be invisable by enemies
data.body: It ables to see enemy power status.

data.title: Custom Warheads refactor and DisabledByWarhead.
data.body:
Allright, so this is a big one, with a lot of code changes in the weapon and warhead code, along with their associated tie-in points.

As such, we probably need very thorough testing. I've done as many tests as I can over the course of doing this, but at some point we probably need more people chipping in on the testing effort.

I've tested all 4 mods after running the new UpgradeRules (engine version 20140720) on the mods (weapons.yaml update). So far I have only found one possible regression that I couldn't nail down. It is in D2K, but I cannot reliably reproduce it. See #2641.

This supersedes #5882.

A quick "How To" guide for making new custom warheads using this branch can be found here: http://pastebin.com/xUg2bfT5

This pull request includes some changes to the yaml (and thus balance) of RA and TD. We probably want to discard these before the pull request is finally accepted, and rerun the UpgradeRules code on a 'clean' set of yaml code for RA and TD.

data.title: Introduce a TransformOnUpgrade trait
data.body:
This could possibly be used for the Component Tower -> Turret Upgrade for TS.

For mods that are more than just C&C remakes, it could also be used to give units an additional barrel, different graphics etc.

Could be a quite interesting feature, especially in combination with #6003 (gaining additional weapon via upgrade, losing it when critically damaged).

data.title: Introduce a TransformOnDamage trait
data.body:
With TS cyborgs in mind. Preferably let the modder choose at which damage level the transformation is supposed to happen.

Could also be used to simulate units losing weapons through damage etc.
A requirement for that to work would be the inheritance of information like experience/veterancy from the transforming unit.

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3210759-introduce-a-transformondamage-trait?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Allowed walls to attach to component towers
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4970 for Tiberian Sun.

data.title: Missiles fired from outside the map are immediately destroyed
data.body:
The aircraft fires its missiles and the pip count decreases, but the missiles get immediately destroyed. From a player's perspective these are wasted.

This is obviously a regression from #5687, which did exactly that to fix missiles going _out of_ the map to workaround a buggy map which had a too small cordon.

data.title: Units shouldn't fire at targets if their projectile can't reach them
data.body:
Submarines for example fire torpedos even if there are rocks in the middle. And if they're close to the obstacle, they damage themselves through splash damage. The same applies to flame tower shooting at a target behind a wall that is next to it.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3208878-units-shouldn-t-fire-at-targets-if-their-projectile-can-t-reach-them?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.body: Polishes and enhances https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits. I tried to describe some old low-level system traits now that we sparked the interest of @gangster-ppm and friends.

data.title: Added bibs to Tiberian Sun refinery and factories
data.body: Picked and polished from https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/commit/fd4ed46315537afcdc0494b1fbf280d4768dd1da.

data.title: Compressed shps of all currently shipping mods
data.body:
I suspected that I didn't catch all of them last time, so I took another, closer look. Turns out I completely forgot about the D2k mod, and missed RA's mouse.shp, as well as TD's Tech Center/Prison make anim, plus lots of smaller files that I had intentionally ignored last time because the gains in absolute numbers wouldn't have been all that significant.

D2k's grenadier.shp yielded the largest single gain, shrinking from 514680 to 32425 bytes. RA's mouse.shp went from 164532 to 37260 bytes. TD missmake.shp went down from 59654 to 28206 bytes. Those were the largest gains in absolute numbers, but several smaller shps showed quite significant compression rates (D2k's fullshroud.shp went from 1080 to a mere 43 bytes, for example).

Total reductions in bytes:
D2k - 509052
RA - 260270
TD - 63664

Should reduce the installer size a little, and shave off a few milliseconds of loading time, especially for D2k and RA.

data.title: Surrender cheat?
data.body:
I was playing a 3v3 game and in the middle of it suddenly our whole team surrendered, without our knowledge. The replay of the game crashes at the point of surrender. It didn't crash during the game.
Here's the replay:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BzbxfjMhrV6eTVh2S19ueFNnZzA/edit?usp=sharing

data.title: Planes don't follow rally point after empty ammo
data.body:
When a yak comes back to airfield on its own after empty ammo, it doesn't follow the rally point, just stays on the airfield. They do follow it after pressing f to reload.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3202005-planes-don-t-follow-rally-point-after-empty-ammo?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Reordered production palette according to prerequisites.
data.body: This is the continuation of #5927. I reordered all tabs according to build prerequisites. If there are two elements of the same type, I put the allies first, e.g. allied barracks before soviet barracks. I also removed ambiguities of multiple elements in the same tab having the same order number, taking into account both factions.

data.title: More aircraft/shroud interaction fixes
data.body:
This is a continuation of #5967, which only made planes not lose their selection when they strayed
outside the map border. This PR makes it possible to select them when they already are outside the map.

Fixes #5651 for real, then.

Also fixes #6001 by making aircraft not attack when they are outside the map. The change will affect both Yaks and Migs, even though Yaks did not have the original problem.

data.title: Naval yard is called shipyard in tooltip
data.body: On the icon it says naval yard, in the tooltip it says shipyard.

data.title: Make sure actors are removed from control groups when captured
data.body: Fixes #5976.

data.title: Play the correct race notification when repairing an ally’s structure.
data.body: It currently uses the announcer voice of the player who owns the structure, when it should be using the announcer of the player doing the repairing.

data.title: Fix frozen actors being targetable under shroud.
